intro: Qualea calantha, commonly known as the golden balsa, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple and alternate, often with a hairy texture. Qualea calantha plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
